messageBody:
On 12/10/05, Kent Beck <kentb@...> wrote:
>
> James,
>
> The current design provides testRunStarted(int count) and
> testRunFinished(Runner runner) notification to TestListeners. Is this
> sufficient for your purposes or do you need to be notified when a class'
> tests are about to be run and have finished running?
>
> Sincerely yours,
>
> Kent Beck
> Three Rivers Institute
>

Hi Kent,

That sounds promising, so I'll pull my finger out and take a more thorough
look at the JUnit 4 source and Java 5 stuff this weekend and try to get a
feel for it.

My use case for JUnit 3 was to be notified when a TestSuite that I had
created, rather than an implicit one that JUnit creates for you, was about
to start processing and had finished processing. This nicely let me capture
a hierarchical view of all the TestSuites that had run. I ended up modifying
my TestRunner, since I had constant known case of always having the same
level of nesting for my constructed TestSuites.

A quick scan of the Version4 branch found the the note in the to-do.txt file
about meeting the needs of runner developers! I appreciate that writing a
TestRunner like this is a somewhat specialized activity versus everyday use,
but was wondering if there has been any provision in JUnit 4 for authors of
TestRunners - could you provide any more detail about envisaged use cases?

James
